title: Qualcomm soars after taking aim at Nvidia with new AI chips
description: Qualcomm is trying to break into the market for AI accelerators, which are used to create and run artificial intelligence models.
content:
Qualcomm shares rose to their highest price in 15 months after the company unveiled chips and computers for the lucrative AI data centre market, aiming to challenge Nvidia in the fastest growing part of the industry.

title: Google unveils plan to restart U.S. nuclear plant to power AI infrastructure
description: Google unveiled a plan Monday to restart a nuclear facility in Iowa to power the company’s artificial intelligence infrastructure.
content:

title: Robot dogs and AI drone swarms: How China could use DeepSeek for an era of war
description: A review of research papers, patents and procurement records gives a snapshot of Beijing's systematic effort to harness artificial intelligence for military advantage.

title: Who Is Vishal Shah, Appointed To Key AI Role By Mark Zuckerberg?
description: Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg has promoted veteran executive Vishal Shah to a key position within the company's AI division, according to a Financial Times report. It marks the latest move in Zuckerberg’s ongoing leadership reshuffle amid his rapid drive into artificial intelligence (AI).

title: How Saudi Arabia is diversifying away from oil - and betting big on AI
description: While oil is the primary driver of Saudi Arabia's economy, the kingdom is now diversifying into areas such as artificial intelligence, tourism and sports.
content:
Think of Saudi Arabia and the first thing that comes to mind might be its massive, oil-derived wealth.

title: From Cloud to Edge: Why Context-Aware AI Is the Future"
description: As artificial intelligence becomes deeply embedded into critical infrastructure, everyday devices and human decision-making, the limitations of cloud-centric AI models are becoming more evident. Relying on distant data centers to process sensor inputs or make predictions introduces latency, raises privacy concerns and increases operational fragility especially in scenarios requiring real-time, local adaptation.
